page.title: 03Farming Continued
page.content: Woodland. The woodland in this area is nearly all coniferous _ larch and spruce, which are grown in a rotation of between 45 and 80 years depending on climatic and economic factors. All the woodland work- planting, trimming, felling and fencing, is contracted out by the landowner. The trees are grown for the pulp manufacturing industry and fencing posts. All the fencing material is processed by pressure impregnated preservatives at the woodmill at Netherwitton. Game rearing: Pheasant and partridge are reared for the Netherwitton shoot and for sale to other shoots. Shooting: One day shoots are run on a commercial basis for foreign and British customers- pheasant, partidge, duck and roe-deer stalking. There is some day let fishing for trout.
